prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story: What the he'll is going on that we are struggling with these facilities that take care of the mentally challenged or health care for Alzheimer's patients that have other medical issues?  St. Mary's in Grand Junction just discharged a friend who broke a hip and has Alzheimer's without rehab for the hip and no place with beds open for Alzheimer's!  Ludicrous!  The "authorities" closed the facility to accommodate "challenged " residents here last year and re-located them to Denver.  Again, ridiculous!  Our health care system is without compassion and based on the bottom line!  The worst part is drug addicts, emergency room mangers of all sorts can get care but we treat those who have health issues as seniors like shit! Sad state of affairs!  Shame on healthcare and those who do not fight for dignity in end of life care!  Shameful!  Politicians should be shamed for not supporting a bill that cares for these people!
stories:
What on earth is happening that we are having such a hard time with facilities responsible for the care of individuals with mental challenges or those suffering from Alzheimer's disease along with other medical conditions? St. Mary's in Grand Junction recently discharged a friend of mine who has a broken hip and Alzheimer's, without providing hip rehabilitation or a place with available beds for Alzheimer's care! It's absurd!

The "authorities" shut down the facility last year to make way for "challenged" residents and moved them to Denver. Once again, this is ridiculous! Our healthcare system is devoid of compassion and prioritizes profit over people! The worst part is that drug addicts and emergency room managers of all kinds can receive care, while we treat senior citizens with health issues as if they are worthless. It's a sad state of affairs!

Shame on healthcare and those who do not advocate for dignity in end-of-life care! It's shameful! Politicians should be embarrassed for not supporting a bill that cares for these individuals!

Why is it that we're facing so much difficulty with facilities responsible for the care of individuals with mental health issues or those with diseases like Alzheimer's and other medical conditions? For instance, my friend with a broken hip and Alzheimer's was discharged from St. Mary's in Grand Junction without any hip rehabilitation or a place for Alzheimer's care. It's utterly preposterous!

The facility was closed down last year to accommodate "challenged" residents and moved them to Denver. Once again, this situation is unacceptable! Our healthcare system seems to lack empathy and prioritizes profit over people. What's worse is that drug addicts and various emergency room managers receive care, while we treat senior citizens with health issues as if they are of no value. It's a deplorable state of affairs!

Healthcare and those who don't advocate for dignity in end-of-life care should be ashamed. It's disgraceful! Politicians should feel embarrassed for not backing a bill that supports these individuals.

It's puzzling why there are such significant obstacles in the facilities responsible for taking care of people with mental health issues or medical conditions like Alzheimer's disease. Take, for example, my friend who, after breaking her hip and being diagnosed with Alzheimer's, was released from St. Mary's in Grand Junction without any hip rehabilitation or Alzheimer's care. It's just absurd!

The facility where she was previously housed was shut down last year to cater to "challenged" residents, who were then transferred to Denver. This situation is far from ideal. It seems that our healthcare system prioritizes profits over people and shows a lack of empathy, especially towards senior citizens with health issues. What's even more alarming is that drug addicts and emergency room managers receive care, while those with serious health concerns are neglected. It's a disheartening state of affairs!

Healthcare professionals and those who don't advocate for dignity in end-of-life care should feel ashamed. It's a shameful situation! Politicians should feel embarrassed for not supporting a bill that benefits these individuals.

It's perplexing why there are substantial barriers in facilities caring for individuals with mental health issues or medical conditions such as Alzheimer's disease. To illustrate, my friend, after sustaining a hip fracture and being diagnosed with Alzheimer's, was discharged from St. Mary's in Grand Junction without any hip rehabilitation or Alzheimer's care. This situation is simply unreasonable.

The establishment where she initially resided closed down last year to accommodate "challenged" residents, who were then relocated to Denver. This scenario is less than optimal. It appears that our healthcare system prioritizes profits over the welfare of individuals, specifically senior citizens with health issues. What's even more distressing is that drug addicts and emergency room managers receive care, while those with severe health concerns are overlooked. This is a disappointing state of affairs.

Those in the medical profession and those who don't advocate for dignity in end-of-life care should experience shame. It's a regrettable situation! Politicians should feel embarrassed for not backing a bill that benefits these individuals.
